001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.StaticUtility;
004
005/**
006 * Implements utility functions to operate on floats
007 */
008@StaticUtility
009public final class Floats {
010
011    /**
012     * The EPSILON we are using for considering floats equal. (solve problems like: 0,99999999... vs 1,0)
013     */
014    public static final float EPSILON = 1e-6f;
015
016    public static final float[] EMPTY = new float[0];
017
018    private Floats() {
019    }
020
021    /**
022     * Returns true if float a and b are closer than EPSILON from each other.
023     *
024     * @param a the float to compare to b
025     * @param b the float to compare to a
026     * @return if the floats are (enough) equal
027     */
028    public static boolean equals(float a, float b) {
029        return Math.abs(a - b) < EPSILON;
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * Returns true if float a and b are not equal (differ)
034     *
035     * @param a the float to compare to b
036     * @param b the float to compare to a
037     * @return true if the floast are different
038     * @see #equals(float, float)
039     */
040    public static boolean notEquals(float a, float b) {
041        return !equals(a, b);
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Easy way to create float arrays in java
046     *
047     * @param f the floats to put in the array
048     * @return the array
049     */
050    public static Float[] of(Float... f) {
051        return f;
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Returns true if f1 is greater than f2
056     *
057     * @param f1 the float to compare to f2
058     * @param f2 the float to compare to f1
059     * @return if f1 greater than f2
060     * @see #notEquals(float, float)
061     */
062    public static boolean greaterThan(float f1, float f2) {
063        return f1 > f2 && notEquals(f1, f2);
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * Converts an array of floats to a boolean array. True if the float is positive
068     *
069     * @param floats the floats to convert
070     * @return the corresponding booleans
071     */
072    public static boolean[] toBooleans(float[] floats) {
073        boolean[] booleans = new boolean[floats.length];
074        for (int i = 0; i < floats.length; i++) {
075            booleans[i] = floats[i] > 0.0f;
076        }
077        return booleans;
078    }
079
080    public static boolean[] toBooleans(Float[] floats) {
081        boolean[] booleans = new boolean[floats.length];
082        for (int i = 0; i < floats.length; i++) {
083            booleans[i] = floats[i] > 0.0f;
084        }
085        return booleans;
086    }
087}
